Eric Schmidt , who was made Google CEO in 2001 to provide greater management experience at the youthful company, explained that the decision had been taken to`` simplify our management structure and speed up decision making''. By clarifying our individual roles, we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, he said.`` In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come.''
